intro: Phyllanthus pseudoparvifolius, commonly known as the small-leaved phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or herb, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several small, smooth seeds. This species is of interest in botanical studies due to its morphological features and potential medicinal properties.
